name: NPR
text:
Disney+ is strengthening its labels that warn viewers of racist depictions and overtones in some of its classic titles, like "Peter Pan" and "The Jungle Book."

The message appears before the title plays and in the program's description.
https://t.co/Q6QrCbh699

name: NPR
text:
The national debt now exceeds the size of the U.S. economy.

"Borrowing to combat the pandemic and economic crisis makes sense. But that's no excuse for the massive tax cuts and spending increases enacted before the pandemic," a fiscal policy expert says. https://t.co/O4ylLf9O9U

name: NPR
text:
Pointing to the group that plotted to kidnap Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, a disinformation expert warned House lawmakers that what happens online can have real-world consequences ‚Äî including violence.

Republicans chose not to attend the hearing.
https://t.co/F6qt1iArOt

name: NPR
text:
Mac Phipps fights for his freedom in court, @louderthanariot looks at the history of Black music being weaponized against its artist and the use of lyrics in court cases.

PLUS: A new witness to the shooting comes forward to NPR.

LISTEN:
https://t.co/cOIhodRMG2 https://t.co/3YgkKUFvgA

name: NPR
text:
A new report by the nonprofit Public Citizen is calling out major retailers ‚Äî including Walmart, Target, Best Buy and Lowe's ‚Äî for donating to trade groups and campaigns promoting harsher shoplifting penalties in at least 18 states.
https://t.co/iHF2RqgrwD

name: NPR
text: Barack Obama will hit the campaign trail for Joe Biden in its final weeks after mostly staying out of the race ‚Äî though he did describe Trump as a failure as president and a threat to democracy during his DNC speech. https://t.co/w04D1na63W

name: NPR
text:
Police in Bangkok used water cannons to disperse protesters a day after the government banned demonstrations calling for the resignation of Thailand's prime minister, reform of its monarchy, and a new constitution. 
https://t.co/lm3RFSzsAP

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration has announced a new, opt-in program for nursing homes that would have pharmacies deliver and administer a future coronavirus vaccine on site.
https://t.co/9PoTVnydWE

name: NPR
text:
California appears to be backing off legal threats against the state's Republican Party over its use of unauthorized ballot drop boxes.
 https://t.co/gelIrLjFNo

text:

name: NPR
text:
The "Global Burden of Disease‚Äù report has become the go-to source for tracking and ranking the toll of nearly every conceivable disease.

This year, the authors share some intriguing solutions that give cause for optimism.
https://t.co/RaOxWhloUw

name: NPR
text:
President Trump ‚Äî who has consistently downplayed the threat and impact of the pandemic ‚Äî tested a new message aimed at seniors, telling voters in Florida:

"I'm working as hard as I can so you can kiss and hug your children and grandchildren very soon." https://t.co/UTdiMLJMYE

name: NPR
text:
To watch feminism over the last four years has been to get a clear view into the dance of protest and backlash in American politics.

NPR spoke with women activists about their wins and losses after nearly four years of President Trump.
https://t.co/rA47Vr7n9H

name: NPR
text:
When it comes to protecting your digital security, use long, unique, strong passwords.

They should be *phrases,* an expert tells NPR. She suggests using a secure password manager to keep everything straight.

More tips from @NPRLifeKit:
https://t.co/5TyQtffkjt

name: NPR
text: Hulu's "Helstrom" was intended as a peek into an occult corner of the Marvel Universe. But, our critic says, a general lack of focus prevails, as plot threads keep piling up and unspooling without intersecting. https://t.co/0Tv9fRBYcz

name: NPR
text:
The Library of Congress wrote that Irving Berlin's musical "Top Hat" "proved the perfect tonic for Depression-era audiences." 

85 years later, a modern rendition of one of its dance numbers could be seen as a "pandemic-era" tonic for today's audiences. https://t.co/KfhRqEINhJ

name: NPR
text:
How does the Philly jazz community respond to the pandemic?

Pianist Orrin Evans turns his front porch into a stage. A resident hosts concerts in her backyard. Chris‚Äô Jazz Cafe opens its doors for the first time since the lockdown.
https://t.co/ft9fLPAoPz

name: NPR
text:
As one of Latin America's most renowned photographers, Graciela Iturbide has spent half a century capturing the beauty of Mexico ‚Äî and calling for her country to reclaim its sense of pride and identity.
https://t.co/5eLPMR4fcH

name: NPR
text:
Requiem for a Dream's haunted original score spawned a kind of breakout hit that rippled through media for years following the film's 2000 premiere ‚Äî while also kickstarting a career for its composer, Clint Mansell.
https://t.co/F9DrpvV5Tq

name: NPR
text:
The Justice Department says 21 white supremacists have been indicted on drug and firearms charges in Utah ‚Äî days after alleged white supremacist gang members in 3 other states were brought up on similar charges.
https://t.co/gecKwNG9WJ

text:

name: NPR
text:
Decades ago, Ng≈©gƒ© wa Thiong'o was jailed in Kenya for writing a play in Gƒ©k≈©y≈© ‚Äî his mother tongue ‚Äî rather than English. He says that led him to write an entire novel in Gƒ©k≈©y≈©.

"I wrote it on the only paper available to me, which was toilet paper."
https://t.co/Z9498Wn1z3

name: NPR
text: A judge has ruled the U.S. Agency for Global Media‚Äôs Trump-appointed CEO acted unlawfully in seizing control of a fund designed to sponsor initiatives to ensure people living under repressive regimes have free and safe Internet access. https://t.co/1qlXBNk9ja

name: NPR
text:
Georgia's voter rolls have grown by nearly 2 million since 2013 ‚Äî yet polling places have been cut by almost 10%.

This has primarily caused long lines in nonwhite areas where voter registration has surged and more votes are cast in person on Election Day. https://t.co/sDuhzwfJ6B

name: NPR
text: Georgia is considered a battleground state for control of the White House and U.S. Senate, so the difficulty of voting in Black communities could possibly tip the results on Nov. 3. https://t.co/eNfAoxid5h

name: NPR
text: RT @sarahmccammon: Women‚Äôs rights activists gathering in DC, cities around the country for a march in opposition to Trump and his Supreme Court nominee, Judge Amy Coney Barrett. name: NPR
text: RT @alexleff: While this general served as Mexico‚Äôs defense secretary, he was also ‚ÄúEl Padrino‚Äù of a vicious cartel that ran rings selling meth, heroin, cocaine and pot across the US, prosecutors allege. https://t.co/EaU3mDcRzu

name: NPR
text:
Ballots received after 8 p.m. on Election Day in Michigan cannot be counted, an appeals court has ruled ‚Äî a reminder that election rules in many states remain in flux just over two weeks before the election. 
https://t.co/8H9fudeOqq

name: NPR
text:
Women's Marches are underway in D.C. and hundreds of cities nationwide. With Election Day now less than a month away, mobilizing the women's vote is among this year's themes.
https://t.co/yZlnfc7YhI

name: NPR
text: Officials in France say they've detained nine people in connection to the brutal beheading of a teacher who had allegedly shown caricatures of the Prophet Muhammad during a lesson on freedom of expression.  https://t.co/qdB5MW0x3q

name: NPR
text:
Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern winning reelection isn't surprising: her leadership has helped New Zealand become one of the most successful countries in handling the coronavirus pandemic. 
 https://t.co/tRbKe80dQm

name: NPR
text: Here's how 19 women around the world are drawing upon their inner strength and resilience to face this unprecedented moment. https://t.co/IBZoBMauYa
